title: Introduction to CRISPR screen analysis
questions: How is a guide RNA library created?
What is the difference between a negative and positive screen?
How to analyse CRISPR screen data?
objectives: Describe what CRISPR screen data is
Outline how CRISPR screen data is generated and analysed
key_points: CRISPR screen data can be analysed using MAGeCK and standard read quality tools

abbreviations.CRISPR: Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats
abbreviations.MAGeCK: Model-based Analysis of Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Knockout

workflows.name: Workflow constructed from history 'CRISPR tutorial Kenji'
workflows.title: Workflow constructed from history 'CRISPR tutorial Kenji'
workflows.graph_dot:
digraph main {
  node [fontname="Atkinson Hyperlegible", shape=box, color=white,style=filled,color=peachpuff,margin="0.2,0.2"];
  edge [fontname="Atkinson Hyperlegible"];
  0[color=lightblue,label="ℹ️ Input Dataset\nbroadgpp-brunello-library-contents.csv"]
  1[color=lightblue,label="ℹ️ Input Dataset\nCalabrese_SetA_Guides_Reference.csv"]
  2[color=lightblue,label="ℹ️ Input Collection\nInput Dataset Collection"]
  3[label="FastQC"]
  2 -> 3 [label="output"]
  4[label="Cutadapt"]
  2 -> 4 [label="output"]
  5[label="MultiQC"]
  3 -> 5 [label="text_file"]
  6[label="MAGeCK count"]
  4 -> 6 [label="out1"]
  7[label="MAGeCKs test"]
  6 -> 7 [label="counts"]
}
